It was not, indeed, possible to identify the Jus Gentium with the Lex Naturae, for a J us cannot be the same as a Lex. But it might be regarded as the produet of that Lex, as its concrete expression in human society. The immediate product, however, of the Lex Naturae is the Jus Naturale. The Jus Gentium tended, therefore, to he identified with the J us Naturale; and the identification seems to be complete except in one important point.
